meanings.definition: A person or thing that brings about equilibrium.
meanings.sent1: The equilibrators in the ecosystem ensure a balance between predators and prey.
meanings.sent2: The equilibrators in the chemical reaction stabilized the mixture.
meanings.sent3: The equilibrators at the party made sure everyone had a good time without any conflicts.
meanings.sent4: Her calming presence acted as an equilibrator in the chaotic office environment.
meanings.sent5: The equilibrators in nature work silently to maintain harmony among all living beings.

meanings.sent1: The scientists studied the equilibrators to understand their impact on the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The equilibrators were essential tools in the laboratory for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent3: The box of equilibrators looked like a collection of tiny weights for a dollhouse.
meanings.sent4: The equilibrators on the scale danced up and down as the weight shifted.
meanings.sent5: Each of the equilibrators played a crucial role in maintaining the balance of the system.
